title: Queen Maxima arrives for the Mental Health and Psychological Support Conference in Amsterdam
text:
Queen Maxima of the Netherlands oozed style and radiance as she arrived for the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support conference in Amsterdam.

The royal, 48, displayed her sartorial prowess as she greeted crowds of excited spectators to speak at the city's Royal Tropical Institute on Tuesday.

Sporting a beige boat neck top with a large crystal brooch on one side, the monarch appeared in high spirits as she made her way to the venue.

Queen Maxima of the Netherlands sported a beige boat neck top as she arrived for the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support conference in Amsterdam

The royal teamed her stylish ensemble with matching trousers and a slick handbag by her side as she arrived for the event

Maxima teamed her stylish top with a pair of matching wide-leg beige trousers carried a neat clutch bag in a matching shade.

The queen accessorised her look with a pair of dazzling jewelled earrings, beaded bracelets on her right arm and a dainty gold necklace on her left.

Sweeping her blonde locks into a loose bun, she completed her look with beige heeled shoes and touch of pink lipstick.

During the conference, the queen met with NGO representatives, care workers and specialists in the field about psychosocial care in crisis situations and areas.

The mother-of-three daughters, Catharina-Amalia, 14, Alexia, 12, and Ariane, 10, was not joined by her husband Willem-Alexander, 52, who became king after his mother, Beatrix, abdicated in April 2013.

The queen accessorised her look with beaded bracelets on her right arm and a dainty gold necklace on her left

Maxima swept her blonde locks into a loose bun and added a touch of pink lipstick and blush to her face

The mother-of-three met with the event organiser and Minister for Foreign Trade and Development Cooperation Sigrid Kaag during the conference

The day also saw the royal sit down to speak with the conference organiser and Minister for Foreign Trade and Development Cooperation Sigrid Kaag about the importance of mental health care in the country.

Prior to her meeting with Maxima, the Dutch politician shared her honour at being able to speak with the royal at the conference.

A tweet shared last month read: 'Very honored that Her Majesty Queen Máxima will attend the international conference #mindthemindnow #mhpss organized by @DutchMFA on October 7&8.

The royal discussed the importance of psychosocial support with Sigrid and shared her passion for more mental healthcare in the country

Maxima smiled for the cameras as she shared her support for more awareness to be raised for the shortage of care workers in the mental health field

Prior to her meeting with Maxima, Sigrid shared her excitement at being able to meet with the royal

'Mental health and psychosocial support in crisis situations is not a luxury, but a necessity.'

The conference, which was also attended by policymakers, politicians and people who had experienced mental health issues, also looked at how conflict, violence and natural disasters played a role in one's psychological health.

The conference, which is running from October 7-8, is hoped to raise awareness of the shortage of care workers in the mental health field and the importance of mental healthcare in the country.
description: Queen Maxima of the Netherlands, 48, sported a beige boat neck top and matching trousers as she arrived for the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support conference in Amsterdam.
